newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY RADIO NOON HEADLINES - OCT 29.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY RADIO NOON HEADLINES - OCT 29.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
- Germany, U.S. and France are the biggest investors in Hungary. Hungary's financial assessment has continued to improve, the president of the National Bank of Hungary said.

- The president of the supervisory board of state privatisation agency APV Rt said he could prove with documents that the former chairman of the APV board, Imre Szokai, mandated Marta Tocsik to intermediate.
- Hungary's Defence Ministry will propose to the parliament that Hungary would continue to participate in the peacekeeping program after the expiry of the mandate of the IFOR forces.

- Gyorgy Suranyi, president of the National Bank of Hungary, proposed to the Prime Minister not to accept the resignations of the vice presidents because their only fault is not in proportion with the successful work in the past years.
